Alastir
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017, 1:33:22 AM

Someone shouts, "The dwarven blacksmith assistant will now give you a quote for work in the smithy. He is located in the Bloodforge. The smithy is scheduled to open tomorrow afternoon!"

@wyrom posted Smithy Price Quotes

The dwarven blacksmith assistant outside the smithy will now give you a quote on your items. Simply ASK ASSISTANT ABOUT SERVICES with the gear in hand. This does not require an invite and will give you an idea of bloodscrip costs so you're prepared for the smithy!

We will have the smithy fully available tomorrow afternoon.

Wyrom, PM

@Coase posted http://forums.play.net/forums/GemStone%20IV/Paid%20Events:%20Adventures,%20Quests,%20and%20SimuCoins/Duskruin%20Arena/view/7926

One important caveat to note is that if the item that you are getting a price quote on is scripted and the price seems very high, use the BUGITEM command, targetting the item in question, with the problem description: "Please review item script cost for weighting/padding/sighting". If your item script is less than auction quality and especially if it is just a fluff script, there is a good chance that once we review it it, it will be less costly to add weighting/padding/sighting to.

Coase

Sabotage
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017, 2:09:22 AM

One important caveat to note is that if the item that you are getting a price quote on is scripted and the price seems very high, use the BUGITEM command, targetting the item in question, with the problem description: "Please review item script cost for weighting/padding/sighting". If your item script is less than auction quality and especially if it is just a fluff script, there is a good chance that once we review it it, it will be less costly to add weighting/padding/sighting to.

Coase

http://forums.play.net/forums/GemStone%20IV/Paid%20Events:%20Adventures,%20Quests,%20and%20SimuCoins/Duskruin%20Arena/view/7926

Estild
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017, 2:32:54 AM

@sabotage said in Official: Duskruin - August 2017 - Smithy Price Quotes:

This doesnâ€™t even take in to account that the price scales as you add padding

No, it doesn't. The amount of weighting/padding on the item is not a factor. All factors being the same, the 1st service costs the same as the 5000th service, if no surcharge is added for multiple services during a 60 day service window. But if you price adding damage weighting when the item has critical weighing, the latter is a factor for the price (and vice versa).

ArchSenex
Tuesday, August 29th, 2017, 8:15:17 AM

ok.. I'm rounding, but so far all numbers seem to show that the scaling is based solely on number of services, there's no script that makes the scaling worse.

After 5 Services, there's a roughly 25% upcharge (from Base). After 10 Services, there's a roughly 200% upcharge (from Base). After 15 Services, there's a roughly 250% upcharge (from Base). After 20 Services, there's a roughly 1000% upcharge (from Base)

So yes, once you hit the "fast" tier, you are paying 11x as much. The first 10 are REALLY efficient.
